oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXTREME SEA LEVELS FROM TIDE AND SURGE PROBABILITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pugh, D.T.
Vassie, J.M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sea level
extreme sea level
tide
surge
probability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper considers a method of deriving the probability of occurrence of extreme sea levels by combining the probability functions of surge and tide. As a result the quantity of data required is less than with traditional methods. The philosophy of the method is discussed and the conditions under which the theory can be applied are examined. Finally the technique is applied to a number of ports in the United Kingdom and the results are compared with known estimates of extreme levels.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 16 (1978): Proceedings of 16th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Hamburg, Germany, 1978.; 52
